intro: Carpodinus flava, commonly known as the yellow orchid, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers with intricate patterns. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid forest environments. Its roots are specialized for absorbing moisture and nutrients from the air and rain. The botanical features of Carpodinus flava make it a popular ornamental plant in horticulture.
